abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's revised guidelines on cellphone use do not recommend caution concerning radiation risk, but there is debate among health agencies and scientists about whether to issue guidance as mobile device use soars.

headline.print_headline: At C.D.C., Evolution of Advice on Phones
headline.main: At C.D.C., a Debate Behind Recommendations on Cellphone Risk

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: While consensus holds that there is little to no evidence linking cellphone use to an increased risk of health problems, scientists and health agencies disagree about what guidance to give the public.
lead_paragraph: While consensus holds that there is little to no evidence linking cellphone use to an increased risk of health problems, scientists and health agencies disagree about what guidance to give the public.
